filename: Virk et al. - 2023 - RIDDLE ME THIS A RARE CASE OF DIFFUSE PULMONARY MENINGIOTHELIOMAS.pdf

fields_extracted.case_count_quote: Here, we present a case of diagnostic dilemma in a patient with a history of malignancy and immunosuppression presenting with diffuse pulmonary meningotheliomatosis (DPM).
fields_extracted.patient_age_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast
fields_extracted.patient_sex_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast
fields_extracted.presenting_symptoms_quote: diagnosed with diffuse pulmonary nodules incidentally via CT angiogram chest during inpatient admission for COVID-19 infection
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method: bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL) with transbronchial cryo biopsy
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method_quote: The patient eventually underwent bronchoscopy with bronchioalveolar lavage (BAL) with transbronchial cryo biopsy of lung nodules
fields_extracted.imaging_findings: numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
fields_extracted.imaging_findings_quote: a follow-up CT scan chest 1 year later showed numerous sub 6 mm bilateral centrilobular GGNs and solid pulmonary nodules with mild upper lobe predominance
fields_extracted.histopathology_quote: which showed MPMNs with further immunostaining negative for malignancy
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry_quote: which showed MPMNs with further immunostaining negative for malignancy
fields_extracted.treatment_quote: given the complexity of the case, lack of symptoms, and stability of nodules, a decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans
fields_extracted.outcome_quote: given the complexity of the case, lack of symptoms, and stability of nodules, a decision was made for close follow-up with serial CT scans
fields_extracted.comorbidities: ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunodeficiency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, thyroid follicular cancer
fields_extracted.comorbidities_quote: A 61-year-old female with a history of ductal hyperplasia of the breast, common variable immunode /uniFB01 ciency syndrome (CVID), asthma, obstructive sleep apnea, and thyroid follicular cancer
fields_extracted.filename: Virk et al. - 2023 - RIDDLE ME THIS A RARE CASE OF DIFFUSE PULMONARY MENINGIOTHELIOMAS.pdf
fields_extracted.extraction_notes: High confidence in most extractions as they are directly quoted from the text. The case appears to be well-documented with clear presentation, diagnostic methods, and follow-up plan.

filename: Fadl et al. - 2021 - Minute Pulmonary Meningothelial-like Nodules.pdf

fields_extracted.case_count_quote: A 63-year-old woman was referred for dedicated chest CT imaging
fields_extracted.presenting_symptoms: Incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules during abdominal CT for diarrhea
fields_extracted.presenting_symptoms_quote: incidentally discovered pulmonary nodules at an abdominal CT scan performed for evaluation of diarrhea
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method_quote: Right lower lobe transbronchial cryobiopsy histopathologic findings
fields_extracted.imaging_findings: Numerous small (< 6 mm), rounded, ground-glass, randomly distributed nodules with no lobe spared. Some nodules showed central lucencies with a ringlike appearance
fields_extracted.imaging_findings_quote: Chest CT showed numerous small ( , 6 mm), rounded, ground-glass, randomly distributed nodules with no lobe spared. Some nodules  showed  central  lucencies  with  a  ringlike  appearance
fields_extracted.histopathology: Nodular cellular proliferation expanding the interstitium with whorllike appearance
fields_extracted.histopathology_quote: nodular cellular proliferation  expanding  the  interstitium  with  whorllike  appearance
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry: Positive staining for epithelial membrane antigen and progesterone receptor, negative staining for neuroendocrine markers such as synaptophysin
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry_quote: Immunohistochemistry  with positive staining for epithelial membrane antigen and progesterone receptor, but negative staining for neuroendocrine markers such as synaptophysin
fields_extracted.comorbidities_quote: abdominal CT scan performed for evaluation of diarrhea
fields_extracted.filename: Fadl et al. - 2021 - Minute Pulmonary Meningothelial-like Nodules.pdf
fields_extracted.extraction_notes: Most data points are clearly stated in the text. Treatment and outcome are not mentioned. The presenting symptoms are clearly documented as an incidental finding during workup for diarrhea.

filename: Hirakawa et al. - 2025 - Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis Presenting with the Cheerios Sign Diagnosed by a Transbronchi.pdf

fields_extracted.case_count_quote: A 48-year-old woman with Turner syndrome presented with diffuse pulmonary nodules exhibiting the Cheerios sign.
fields_extracted.patient_age_quote: A 48-year-old non-smoking woman presented with an abnormal shadow on chest radiography during routine health screening.
fields_extracted.patient_sex_quote: A 48-year-old non-smoking woman presented with an abnormal shadow on chest radiography during routine health screening.
fields_extracted.presenting_symptoms_quote: Although the patient had few symptoms, she visited a local hospital because of the results of the routine health screening.
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method_quote: TBLC was performed using a 1.9 mm cryoprobe with a 6second freezing time and the blood-blocking balloon technique. One sample was obtained from each of the right B 8b and B 9 segments where the Cheerios sign was clearly observed.
fields_extracted.imaging_findings: Diffuse centrilobular granular opacities and nodular shadows in both lungs, with some nodules having central lucency with a surrounding thin wall (Cheerios sign)
fields_extracted.imaging_findings_quote: CT of the chest showing diffuse centrilobular granular opacities and nodular shadows in both lungs. Some nodules had central lucency with a surrounding thin wall, consistent with the 'Cheerios sign'.
fields_extracted.histopathology: Multiple small nodules measuring approximately 2 mm in diameter in the interstitium, consisting of low-grade, round to short spindle-shaped cells resembling meningeal epithelial cells, with uniform round nuclei and eosinophilic cytoplasm. No cellular atypia, necrosis, or significant inflammation observed.
fields_extracted.histopathology_quote: Histopathological examinations of both specimens revealed multiple small nodules measuring approximately 2 mm in diameter in the interstitium. The nodules consisted of low-grade, round to short spindle-shaped cells resembling meningeal epithelial cells, with uniform round nuclei and eosinophilic cytoplasm. No cellular atypia, necrosis, or significant inflammation was observed.
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry: Positive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA), progesterone receptor (PgR), and CD56
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry_quote: Immunohistochemically, these cells were positive for the epithelial membrane antigen (EMA), progesterone receptor (PgR), and CD 56
fields_extracted.treatment: Discontinuation of estrogen and progesterone hormone therapy
fields_extracted.treatment_quote: Given the potential hormonal influence on both the DPM and uterine polyps, estrogen and progesterone supplementation was discontinued, with the expectation that hormone withdrawal might halt disease progression.
fields_extracted.outcome: Stable disease without progression over 7-month follow-up
fields_extracted.outcome_quote: The patient's pulmonary function did not decline, and both the clinical and radiological findings remained stable during the seven-month follow-up period without treatment.
fields_extracted.comorbidities_quote: The patient had a history of Turner syndrome and had been receiving hormone supplementation with estrogen and progesterone since childhood. At the time of the DPM diagnosis, the patient was diagnosed with a uterine polyp.
fields_extracted.filename: Hirakawa et al. - 2025 - Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis Presenting with the Cheerios Sign Diagnosed by a Transbronchi.pdf
fields_extracted.extraction_notes: The case is well-documented with clear clinical details, imaging findings, pathology results, and follow-up information. The only minor uncertainty might be around the completeness of symptom reporting, though the text suggests the patient was largely asymptomatic.

filename: Saa and Assaf - 2022 - A Rare Case of Pulmonary Nodules Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis.pdf

fields_extracted.presenting_symptoms: Worsening dyspnea with cold symptoms including cough
fields_extracted.presenting_symptoms_quote: presented to the clinic for worsening dyspnea since December 2019. Her dyspnea originally started with cold symptoms including a cough; although her cough improved, her dyspnea persisted.
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method: CT chest, bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL), transbronchial lung biopsies (TBBX), and right thoracotomy with multiple lung biopsies
fields_extracted.diagnostic_method_quote: A CT of the chest was obtained... She subsequently underwent a bronchoscopy with bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) and transbronchial lung biopsies (TBBX)... she underwent a right thoracotomy with multiple lung biopsies.
fields_extracted.imaging_findings: Diffuse subcentimetric nodularities in random distribution
fields_extracted.imaging_findings_quote: A CT of the chest was obtained, which showed diffuse subcentimetric nodularities in random distribution.
fields_extracted.histopathology: Nested cells with meningothelial like morphology
fields_extracted.histopathology_quote: Nested cells with meningothelial like morphology (A+B)
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry: Positive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA), CD56, and progesterone receptor
fields_extracted.immunohistochemistry_quote: immunostaining positive for epithelial membrane antigen (EMA), CD56, and progesterone receptor
fields_extracted.comorbidities: Transient ischemic attack, hypertension, and childhood asthma
fields_extracted.comorbidities_quote: with a past medical history of transient ischemic attack, hypertension, and childhood asthma on albuterol
fields_extracted.filename: Saa and Assaf - 2022 - A Rare Case of Pulmonary Nodules Diffuse Pulmonary Meningotheliomatosis.pdf
fields_extracted.extraction_notes: Most data points are clearly stated in the text. Treatment and outcome are not explicitly mentioned. The diagnostic process is well documented through multiple procedures.
